ISSUE.TITLE: Passing a string with a space to `--network-alias` creates a container unable to resolve names (DNS)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description Creating a container with `--network-alias`, where the alias contains a space, will prevent the new container from resolving domain names. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. `podman network create test` 2. `podman container run --rm -it --network test --network-alias "a b" alpine` 3. Inside the container: `ping podman.io` Also reproducible if the container is created through the socket API (`podman system service`). ### Describe the results you received ``` / # ping podman.io ping: bad address 'podman.io' ``` ### Describe the results you expected Either: * If spaces are valid in network aliases, name resolution should work as expected. * If spaces are not valid in network aliases, an error should be given at the moment of container creation. ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.39.4 cgroupControllers: -
